ticket.title: Add Drop Confirmation to Rake Tasks
ticket.original-body: db:schema:load just killed all the rows in my db. -Solution- All rake tasks should confirm deletions, drops, and etc... A -f option could bypass confirmations. Example: rm README rm: remove regular file `README'?
ticket.latest-body: db:schema:load just killed all the rows in my db. -Solution- All rake tasks should confirm deletions, drops, and etc... A -f option could bypass confirmations. Example: rm README rm: remove regular file `README'?
ticket.original-body-html: db:schema:load just killed all the rows in my db. -Solution- All rake tasks should confirm deletions, drops, and etc... A -f option could bypass confirmations. Example: rm README rm: remove regular file README'?

version.body:
db:schema:load just killed all the rows in my db.
-Solution-
All rake tasks should confirm deletions, drops, and etc... A -f option could bypass confirmations. Example: rm README rm: remove regular file `README'?
version.body-html:
db:schema:load just killed all the rows in my db.

-Solution-

All rake tasks should confirm deletions, drops, and etc...
A -f option could bypass confirmations.
Example:
rm README
rm: remove regular file README'?
version.title: Add Drop Confirmation to Rake Tasks

version.body: Your README example is flawed. Your rm is aliased to rm -i. @@@ betelgeuse@pena ~/test $ rm -i foo.txt rm: remove regular file `foo.txt'? y betelgeuse@pena ~/test $ touch foo.txt betelgeuse@pena ~/test $ rm foo.txt betelgeuse@pena ~/test $ type rm rm is hashed (/bin/rm) @@@ Tradionally unix utilities assume you know what you are doing.
version.body-html:
Your README example is flawed. Your rm is aliased to rm -i.

betelgeuse@pena ~/test $ rm -i foo.txt
rm: remove regular file foo.txt'? y
betelgeuse@pena ~/test $ touch foo.txt
betelgeuse@pena ~/test $ rm foo.txt
betelgeuse@pena ~/test $ type rm
rm is hashed (/bin/rm)</code>
</pre>
Tradionally unix utilities assume you know what you are doing.
